content:
• Monday, October 10, 2011
  • MAXY

    Maxygen (NASDAQ:MAXY) gains in the post-session after it says the U.S. Patent and Trademark...

    Maxygen (NASDAQ:MAXY) gains in the post-session after it says the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office has rejected all of Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) patent claims to certain molecules that potentially cover Maxygen's MAXY-G34 drug candidate. MAXY +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE:SBH) announces a 15M share secondary offering. The shares for sale...

    Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE:SBH) announces a 15M share secondary offering. The shares for sale are being offered by investment funds associated with Clayton, Dubilier & Rice. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • MG

    Mistras Group (NYSE:MG), a provider of technology solutions for evaluating the integrity of...

    Mistras Group (NYSE:MG), a provider of technology solutions for evaluating the integrity of infrastructure, gains 5.3% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $91.4M (+34% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11; the latter is in-line, but the former beat consensus by $10.3M. The company is affirming its prior guidance for FY12 revenue of $375M-$390M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (NYSE:HFC) says its board of directors has approved the acquisition from its...

    HollyFrontier (NYSE:HFC) says its board of directors has approved the acquisition from its subsidiary refinery, Holly Energy (NYSE:HEP), of certain pipeline assets for $340M. HFC flat, HEP +2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • INSM

    Shares of biotech researcher Insmed (INSM -30%) were hammered today after the FDA notified the...

    Shares of biotech researcher Insmed (INSM -30%) were hammered today after the FDA notified the company that it is continuing the clinical hold previously placed on phase 3 trials for its cystic fibrosis drug Arikace, a treatment for patients with pseudomonas lung infections. The agency says it still doesn't have sufficient data on the associated risks.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (BYI +7.8%) ramps higher after Janney raised the stock to buy earlier today....

    Bally Technologies (BYI +7.8%) ramps higher after Janney raised the stock to buy earlier today. Janney says the company is poised to take an increased share of the game-equipment business. The industry in general will benefit from more than 27K new and expansion slots in 2012, which is important for Bally as it will profit not only from the game shipments but the systems contracts as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SKY

    Shares of prefab home builder Skyline (SKY) tumble -20%, trading near its 52-week low after...

    Shares of prefab home builder Skyline (SKY) tumble -20%, trading near its 52-week low after reporting late Friday its FQ1 loss widened to $0.82 per share from $0.72 cents per share a year earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (ALTH -18%) takes a hit after it says an anonymous bidder has withdrawn a...

    Allos Therapeutics (ALTH -18%) takes a hit after it says an anonymous bidder has withdrawn a takeover offer of $2.20 a share. The company says it will continue working toward with AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +2.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • JVA

    Coffee Holdings (NASDAQ:JVA) racks up a run-of-the-mill 14.8% gain out of thin air, as the stock...

    Coffee Holdings (NASDAQ:JVA) racks up a run-of-the-mill 14.8% gain out of thin air, as the stock continues its pattern of trading 20% or more of outstanding shares on any given day. Slightly more grounded in reality, Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) moves up 4.4% after the WSJ reports on a brewing deal with India's Tata Coffee to add its products to SBUX stores in the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • AAPL

    "OK, now I get it." Apple (AAPL +4%) didn't launch an iPhone 5 because most iPhone 4 owners...

    "OK, now I get it..." Apple (AAPL +4%) didn't launch an iPhone 5 because most iPhone 4 owners are still bound by two-year contracts, so they would be less likely to upgrade now. The 4S is aimed instead at broadening the base of iPhone users. So it's likely that the 5 will be launched next June, when the 4 owners begin to come off their contracts. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • GD

    General Dynamics (GD +2.9%) gains after one of its subsidiaries, C4 Systems, was awarded a $65M...

    General Dynamics (GD +2.9%) gains after one of its subsidiaries, C4 Systems, was awarded a $65M networking support contract by the U.S. Navy's Space and Naval Warfare Systems Center to provide support, maintain and add new capabilities to the the Navy's Wideband Networking Waveform system.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +3%) and its subsidiaries have signed a 15-year pact with Boardwalk...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +3%) and its subsidiaries have signed a 15-year pact with Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP +0.8%) for gas gathering in the Marcellus Shale. Under the deal, Boardwalk Field Services and Southwestern Energy Production will construct a $90M natural gas gathering system which BWP will own and operate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix's (NFLX -1.3%) selloff, occurring in spite of its Qwikster about-face, could have to do...

    Netflix's (NFLX -1.3%) selloff, occurring in spite of its Qwikster about-face, could have to do with fears the move was forced by growing churn. Also possibly playing a role is a downgrade by Wedbush, which thinks Netflix's actions kill the odds of an Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) takeover. Though given Amazon's investments in Prime Video, it's worth asking whether a takeover was ever likely.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 7 Comments
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies ups the shares to buy on...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies ups the shares to buy on valuation.  Jefferies says grower payments have been trending higher, but shouldn't have any negative impact on the company's FY12 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • GOOG

    China's "Great Firewall" has been intermittently blocking Google's (GOOG +3.6%) Android Market...

    China's "Great Firewall" has been intermittently blocking Google's (GOOG +3.6%) Android Market over the last three days, as well as its mobile Gmail app. Google shares don't appear to be affected by the news, but Chinese mobile data services provider Phoenix New Media (FENG -13.8%) is a much different story.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo (WFC +4.7%) upps its stake to 65% in Golden Capital Management, a Charlotte,...

    Wells Fargo (WFC +4.7%) upps its stake to 65% in Golden Capital Management, a Charlotte, NC-based asset management firm with over $6B under management. The bank says the move is going to strengthen its relationship with GCM, as well as significantly expand its quant capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (IBM +1.8%) shares touch an all-time high, making up ~10% of the Dow's current 275-point...

    IBM (IBM +1.8%) shares touch an all-time high, making up ~10% of the Dow's current 275-point advance. In a note today, Janney touts Big Blue's "safety, quality, and positive demand trends... proven business models, sticky revenue streams, outstanding balance sheets." Another Janney recommendation, Accenture (NYSE:ACN), +1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • CWEI

    Oil & gas producer Clayton Williams (CWEI +13.5%) surges after announcing it has terminated...

    Oil & gas producer Clayton Williams (CWEI +13.5%) surges after announcing it has terminated all of its 2012 and 2013 oil hedges for $50M, and will use the proceeds to pay down some of its debt. A massive short interest (24.8% of the float was shorted as of Sep. 15) is probably contributing to the rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -0.4%) shares turn red after popping nearly 10% at the open on the company's...

    Netflix (NFLX -0.4%) shares turn red after popping nearly 10% at the open on the company's decision to scrap its disastrous Qwikster plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • COP

    Crude Oil strength is giving a lift to ConocoPhillips (COP +4.4%) today, despite reports that...

    Crude Oil strength is giving a lift to ConocoPhillips (COP +4.4%) today, despite reports that Ecuador is suing one of its subsidiaries for $504M. The lawsuit is related a dispute over alleged environmental damage from the company's oil operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • DDD

    In a rational market, when share dilution occurs, the price a stock generally goes down, but not...

    In a rational market, when share dilution occurs, the price a stock generally goes down, but not for 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD). The stock has jumped +7.5%, despite shareholders approving an amendment on Friday to double its share count from 60M to 120M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • AEGN

    Insituform Technologies (INSU +7.8%) gets a boost from its announcement of of a $10M stock...

    Insituform Technologies (INSU +7.8%) gets a boost from its announcement of of a $10M stock buyback, saying it plans to buy up to $5M through the end of 2011, and the remainder throughout 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • VRTX

    Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -8.5%) move lower on heavy volume after Pharmasset...

    Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -8.5%) move lower on heavy volume after Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +6.4%) announces further expansion of its Hepatitis C treatment trial, stinging prospects for the company's own line.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (ACI +6.1%) trades up after saying it plans to open a London sales office in Q112, as...

    Arch Coal (ACI +6.1%) trades up after saying it plans to open a London sales office in Q112, as the company expands into new markets in response to a resurgence in export demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • GILD

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +7.3%) trades higher after announcing it's expanding electron trials of...

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +7.3%) trades higher after announcing it's expanding electron trials of its hepatitis C drug treatment after tests showed positive results at a higher dose when combined with other treatments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • YOKU

    Shares of Youko.com (YOKU +13.4%) pop after Barclays initiates the company with an Overweight...

    Shares of Youko.com (YOKU +13.4%) pop after Barclays initiates the company with an Overweight rating, helping allay some of the fear spilling over the company after investigations on accounting fraud hit unspecified Chinese firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTR

    Potash (POT +5.7%) gets a double-pop this morning on an upgrade from Ticonderoga to buy on...

    Potash (POT +5.7%) gets a double-pop this morning on an upgrade from Ticonderoga to buy on valuation, plus a positive article in Barron's over the weekend saying ag-related stocks are poised to gain due to growing global food demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT), up 4.3%, leads a charge of global large-caps higher as investors pile...

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT), up 4.3%, leads a charge of global large-caps higher as investors pile into a sector particularly hard hit on recession fears. Dearborn Partners' Paul Nolte says the jury is still out on if the double-dip recession baking itself into stock prices will occur. "The economic data recently has been a little bit better than expected... the question is whether it's going to be enough to avoid a recession and get us going on a better growth path."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • SNP

    Chinese oil giant Sinopec (SNP -1.9%) declines on an up day for energy stocks following its deal...

    Chinese oil giant Sinopec (SNP -1.9%) declines on an up day for energy stocks following its deal to acquire Canada's Daylight Energy (OTC:DAYYF) at a 100%+ premium to Daylight's Friday close. The acquisition still needs to be vetted by Canadian regulators.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • S

    S&P places Sprint's (S -8.3%) BB- rating "on CreditWatch with negative implications," in the...

    S&P places Sprint's (S -8.3%) BB- rating "on CreditWatch with negative implications," in the wake of Friday's investor conference where the company disclosed "significant capital spending requirements to support (its) network upgrade project."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.2%) moves higher this morning after the FTC approved its merger...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.2%) moves higher this morning after the FTC approved its merger with Cephalon (CEPH +0.4%) over the weekend. As part of the approval, Teva is required to divest two abbreviated new drug applications for fentanyl citrate lozenges, a generic version of Actiq, and cyclobenzaprine ER capsules, the generic version of Amrix.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC -1.2%), whose shares plunged on Friday on fears of an FQ2 shortfall and rumors...

    BMC Software (BMC -1.2%), whose shares plunged on Friday on fears of an FQ2 shortfall and rumors of a senior sales figure leaving the company, is underperforming again today after Collins Stewart slashes its PT to $50 from $62. The firm thinks the rumored departure is possible, given its view that BMC's FQ1 revenue miss is attributable to sales execution.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • VLO

    Dollar weakness sends West Texas crude +3.5% to $85.84/barrel, sparked by the possibility of...

    Dollar weakness sends West Texas crude +3.5% to $85.84/barrel, sparked by the possibility of more eurozone stability and Saudi Arabia's statement that it is unlikely to raise oil output capacity. "A favorable set of fundamentals" supports crude now, a strategist says, returning dollars to riskier assets. Energy stocks (XLE +4%) zoom higher: VLO +6.4%, BHI +5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CAST

    Shares of Chinacast Education (OTCPK:CAST) gain 12.4% after the provider of online education...

    Shares of Chinacast Education (OTCPK:CAST) gain 12.4% after the provider of online education services in China issues an update on its core business and reiterates previously issued FY11 guidance. "Average tuition rates are expected to increase by approximately 5% year-over-year."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK +2.2%) continues to rack up gains after its combination diabetes and choleserol drug...

    Merck (MRK +2.2%) continues to rack up gains after its combination diabetes and choleserol drug Juvisync was approved by the FDA on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • TALO

    Stone Energy (SGY) rockets up 11% after Barclays lifts its rating on shares to Overweight from...

    Stone Energy (SGY) rockets up 11% after Barclays lifts its rating on shares to Overweight from Equal Weight, and helped along with overriding strength in the sector. Offhore drilling rivals: MCF +5.3%, MMR +9.2%, WTI +9.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • WTFC

    Wintrust Financial (WTFC +2.7%) gets a lift from the overall market and strength in financial...

    Wintrust Financial (WTFC +2.7%) gets a lift from the overall market and strength in financial shares today, despite getting cut earlier by Baird to neutral. Baird cites a weaker near-term outlook, NIM compression, and potential higher-than-expected loan loss provisions for the downgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • ARMH

    European tech names are among the big winners in early trading, as shares are bolstered by macro...

    European tech names are among the big winners in early trading, as shares are bolstered by macro news and hopes. ARMH +6.5%. STM +5.4%. NXPI +4.4%. ERIC +5.2%. NOK +5.1%. ALU +5.4%. AIXG +4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +5%) shares rally after Citigroup raises its rating on the largest U.S. maker of...

    Micron (MU +5%) shares rally after Citigroup raises its rating on the largest U.S. maker of computer memory chips to Buy from Hold after "a substantial pullback post-earnings (15.7%) and with spot pricing at our below industry cash cost." Citi's $7 price target is left unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • ICLR

    ICON plc (ICLR -0.2%) lags the general market after JPMorgan cut the shares to neutral over...

    ICON plc (ICLR -0.2%) lags the general market after JPMorgan cut the shares to neutral over concerns that near-term expenses from the company's partnerships will cut into margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • TEX

    Industrial machinery maker Terex (TEX +7%)  surges after stating it will acquire a...

    Industrial machinery maker Terex (TEX +7%)  surges after stating it will acquire a controlling interest in Ritz do Brazil, a manufacturer of equipment for constructing and maintaining power lines. In June, Terex struck a deal to acquire German crane manufacturer Demag Cranes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • LRN

    Shares of K12 (LRN +8.5%) pop after the firm reveals enrollment increased 49% in FQ4. The online...

    Shares of K12 (LRN +8.5%) pop after the firm reveals enrollment increased 49% in FQ4. The online education services company missed the consensus EPS estimate of analysts by $0.07 on revenue of $128M (+46% Y/Y).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • SFSF

    SuccessFactors (SFSF -1.8%) trades lower this morning after BMO cuts the shares to market...

    SuccessFactors (SFSF -1.8%) trades lower this morning after BMO cuts the shares to market perform, citing a decline in HR software demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MAR

    Starwood (HOT) gains 6.8% after grabbing a mention in Barron's as a stock that could double in...

    Starwood (HOT) gains 6.8% after grabbing a mention in Barron's as a stock that could double in price. Analysts point to the company's "asset-light" strategy of focusing on income from managing properties as a driver for improved margins and cash flow. Prospects for hotel growth in China and India are also contributing to the positive buzz on the downtrodden company as an investment play.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • NFLX

    Morgan Stanley and Piper Jaffray voice their approval of Netflix's (NFLX +5.7%) about-face on...

    Morgan Stanley and Piper Jaffray voice their approval of Netflix's (NFLX +5.7%) about-face on Qwikster. Morgan notes the move allows Netflix to continue "leveraging one of its most powerful assets, its cross-platform recommendation algorithm." Piper calls the move "a step in the right direction," but says it may be a sign Netflix is worried about rising churn.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 5 Comments
  • GM

    It's a strong open for shares of General Motors (GM +3.4%) and Ford (F +3.7%), as they easily...

    It's a strong open for shares of General Motors (GM +3.4%) and Ford (F +3.7%), as they easily outperform broad market indexes. The news from Europe set the tone, while word from GM that Sept. sales in China increased 15% Y/Y keeps the tide rolling forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • THS

    BofA tags TreeHouse Foods (NYSE:THS) with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy. Shares are down 1.8%...

    BofA tags TreeHouse Foods (NYSE:THS) with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy. Shares are down 1.8% after going on a 12% run over the last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • CTCM

    Shares of CTC Media (NASDAQ:CTCM) gain 12.4% after landing a Buy rating from Deutsche Bank. It's...

    Shares of CTC Media (NASDAQ:CTCM) gain 12.4% after landing a Buy rating from Deutsche Bank. It's welcome relief for investors of the Russian media concern after the company revised its FY11 revenue forecast less than a month ago, sending shares on a tailspin.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM

  • After plummeting 30% upon being reopened for trade, Dexia shares reverse and are now sharply...

    After plummeting 30% upon being reopened for trade, Dexia shares reverse and are now sharply higher, +7.7% as Europe adds to its morning gains. Stoxx 50 +1.5%. "If anyone has learned anything in the last 10 years, it is NEVER to stand in the way of the 1st blast from the liquidity hose," tweets a trader.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • BAC

    Financial stocks (XLF +3.3%) surge out of the gate, with Bank of America (BAC +4.4%) and Morgan...

    Financial stocks (XLF +3.3%) surge out of the gate, with Bank of America (BAC +4.4%) and Morgan Stanley (MS +4.8%) each up more than 4%, after weekend news that Germany and France have agreed to help strengthen European banks. C +4.5%, JPM +3.8%, WFC +3.5%, AXP +3.1%, TRV +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    Casino stocks are outperforming following a bullish Deutsche note on Macau traffic. The firm...

    Casino stocks are outperforming following a bullish Deutsche note on Macau traffic. The firm believes table games revenue for the first 9 days of October is up 40% Y/Y, leading it to expect monthly revenues to hit a new record. LVS +4.2%. MGM +3.9%. WYNN +3.6%. MPEL +5.1%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • OMEX

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (NASDAQ:OMEX) opens +4.9% after discovering the shipwrecked...

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (NASDAQ:OMEX) opens +4.9% after discovering the shipwrecked SS Mantola, believed to contain more than 600,000 oz. of silver. The U.K. government had awarded OMEX a salvage contract for the ship's cargo which allows the company to retain 80% of the net value of recovered silver. It's the firm's second big haul in as many weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • INSM

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) drops 32.2% after announcing the FDA is maintaining the clinical hold it...

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) drops 32.2% after announcing the FDA is maintaining the clinical hold it placed in August on Phase 3 trials of the company's Arikace drug for treating lung infections. The FDA has requested Insmed conduct an additional study to determine Arikace's toxicity.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • DXBGY

    Dexia shares resume trading in Belgium, -30% from the level they were at when suspended last...

    Dexia shares resume trading in Belgium, -30% from the level they were at when suspended last Thursday. The lender's Belgian banking business was nationalized last night and the liabilities of the remainder of the company guaranteed by Belgium, France, and Luxembourg.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) lands a $45M contract from the NIH for studies related to the...

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) lands a $45M contract from the NIH for studies related to the development of antiviral drugs. Shares +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • CPX

    Premarket gainers: CPX +50%. NFLX +10%. TSL +6%. CLWR +5%. E +5%. NOK +4%. LVLT +4%. MT +4%. TOT...

    Premarket gainers: CPX +50%. NFLX +10%. TSL +6%. CLWR +5%. E +5%. NOK +4%. LVLT +4%. MT +4%. TOT +4%. RIO +4%. ARMH +4%. MU +4%. SNY +4%. MPEL +4%. RDS +4%. YRCW +3%. BAC +3%. IRE +3%. UBS +3%. DB +3%. MS +2%. SD +3%. YHOO +3%. AA +3%. FCX +3%. C +3%. MGM +3%. NVS +3%. AKS +3%. JPM +3%. AMD +3%.
    Losers: SPN -7%. NBG -5%. S -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) -4.6% premarket after at least five firms downgrade the stock following Friday's...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) -4.6% premarket after at least five firms downgrade the stock following Friday's brutal investor meeting. Analysts at Deutsche Bank (earlier), JPMorgan, Raymond James, Collins Stewart and Kaufman Bros. all point to management that continues to keep everyone guessing on earnings and cash needs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) warns it expects FY11 EPS in the range of $2.70-$2.75, below a...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) warns it expects FY11 EPS in the range of $2.70-$2.75, below a consensus of $2.98, due to "an unexpected year-over-year decline in consumer purchases." The fertilizer maker, which fell on a guidance cut in August, reports FY11 earnings on November 8.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) shares +10% premarket on news the company is nixing Qwikster. "One...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) shares +10% premarket on news the company is nixing Qwikster. "One website, one account, one password ... in other words, no Qwikster," writes CEO Reed Hastings on the company's blog.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • S

    Deutsche downgrades Sprint (NYSE:S) to Hold from Buy, saying Friday's analyst meeting failed to...

    Deutsche downgrades Sprint (NYSE:S) to Hold from Buy, saying Friday's analyst meeting failed to impress. Analysts with the firm point to an unclear direction for Sprint's 4G spectrum strategy, as well as open questions on funding for its Network Vision and the long-term financial impact of iPhone sales. Shares -4.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM

  • EU shares are mixed following the latest Merkel-Sarkozy rescue pledge, with the lack of details...

    EU shares are mixed following the latest Merkel-Sarkozy rescue pledge, with the lack of details and Fitch's downgrades of Italy (I) and Spain (II) on Friday possibly acting as a drag. Euro STOXX 600 Banks index -1.4%, Euro STOXX 50 +0.2%, London +0.2%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 AM
